I would rewrite this to fail the deployment / startup when any of the keys is null. Or not create this Provider at all if the provider can be absent

timeline.bodyText: The method only throws TechnicalExceptions, so why use OsgpException in the throws clause?
timeline.author: rlemmers

timeline.bodyText: We normally use Orika for mapping.
timeline.author: rlemmers

timeline.bodyText: Do not use the "Db" prefix for repositories and entities.
timeline.author: rlemmers

timeline.bodyText:
We normally don't use the creation_time (and modification_time) in the code. And we've had some problems in the few places where we did use those columns. Consider using a separate column.
Or would it be possible to just select "max(es.id)" instead of searching the highest creation_time?
When searching a value, both edges (valid_from = :date and valid_to = :date) are excluded. I would expect at least one of those two to be included.
timeline.author: rlemmers

timeline.bodyText: Avoid using the old java.util.Date class. ZonedDateTime is a better one.
timeline.author: rlemmers

replies.bodyText: The date is also used in the call to the "find" for the DB, so using java.util.Date is still necessary. I'll mark this comment as resolved.
replies.author: rlemmers

timeline.bodyText: Your IDE should be able to format this nicely automatically (the same goes for the previous "@Formatter" code.
timeline.author: rlemmers

timeline.message:
Revert "Remove tests for build"

This reverts commit bde1481a55eb7557be924ba8e0129113827c4162.
Disable failing unit tests, solve minor sonar issues

Merge pull request #375 from OSGP/test_2077

Test 2077
Added fix for not finding external logback configuration
Removed file appender for integration test
Add secret management to pom and database

timeline.bodyText: Remove the literal "false" boolean value.
timeline.author: jenkins-ip-10-4-24-184

timeline.message: Undo groovy change for release branch
Initial version of secret management service and repo's
Removed generate secret method for now
Added encryption/decryption & exception handling to service
Changes resulting from discussion with Erik
Added dynamic encryption provider type key lookup
Changes to accomodate key dereferencing and code cleanup/shuffle
Added repository IT & fixed persistency related problems
Added encryption provider type to repo find method
Moved IT and changed test default to JRE encryption
IT and unit tests (work in progress)
Added test asserts on secret stored to DB
Added expected response (context todo); added test request and response folders
Added repo IT for key repo
SLIM-2077 load keyfile on init and coverage improvents
Fixed bug regarding NOT NULL constraint for creation time
Removed constraint on unique secrets; added check on adding existing (identical) secret; changed retrieval (get latest valid secret)
Fixed bug (regarding incorrect query generation for DB paging) by changing repo query
Fixed inconsistent ITs caused by timing issue in query
Changed repo query (no encryption provider type parameter)

timeline.bodyText: do yo need a native query per se ?
timeline.author: coendamen

replies.bodyText: Unfortunately, I do. Jpql doesn't support LIMIT. Alternative option (which I tried first) is to use Jpql in combination with pagination, but this resulted in an error (hibernate tries to generate a count query, but this query was incorrect SQL) and might also be less performant.
replies.author: jandik

replies.bodyText: hmm, I think there is a setMaxResults setting on a query, maybe could be worth a try
replies.author: coendamen

replies.bodyText: the setMaxResults property applies to a Hibernate query, not on a Spring query annotation
replies.author: jandik

timeline.message: SLIM-2512 exchange the shared secret AES with PKI (RSA)
SLIM-2512-HSTN - exchange the shared secret AES with PKI (RSA)

timeline.bodyText: @propertysource annotations should be placed on Main.class. That class is annotated with @SpringBootApplication and will be loaded before @configuration annotated classes (which need those properties!)
timeline.author: jboon

Use @value("${component.name:OSGP-SECRET-MANAGEMENT}") to provide default value.
